paragraphs.text:
%md # Introduction to Splice Machine Advanced Developer Training This class is recommended for query writers, ETL processors, and developers who are working with Splice Machine. To understand this content, you need to have first completed our *Splice Machine Developer Training, Part I* and *Splice Machine Developer Training, Part II* classes. You can expect to spend 2-3 hours completing this class, which contains the following sequence of notebooks:
1. This class starts with our Architecture notebook, which will give you and understanding of the architecture of Splice Machine.
2. The Statistics notebook shows you how we use database statistics to optimize queries, and how you can use those same statistics for query tuning.
3. The Bulk Data Loading notebook introduces and walks you through using our Bulk HFile Import mechanism for highly performant loading of data.
4. The Transactions in Splice Machine notebook teaches you how transactions are processed in Splice Machine.
5. The Query Optimization notebook shows you advanced optimization techniques for boosting query performance.
6. The Prepared Statements notebook teaches you how to use prepared statements for querying your databases.
7. The User-Defined Functions and Procedures notebook walks you through creating, using, and modifying functions and procedures that you can use for complex database queries.
8. The Using spark-submit with the Native Spark DataSource notebook shows you how to take advantage of the Splice Machine Native Spark DataSource when running apps with spark-submit.
9. The Exercises for This Class notebook contains a number of exercises that you should complete to test your understanding of the content in this class.
Note that each notebook contains a link to the next notebook in the sequence, and many of the notebooks also contain links to related pages in our Splice Machine Documentation web.

msg.data:
Introduction to Splice Machine Advanced Developer Training

This class is recommended for query writers, ETL processors, and developers who are working with Splice Machine.

To understand this content, you need to have first completed our Splice Machine Developer Training, Part I and Splice Machine Developer Training, Part II classes.

You can expect to spend 2-3 hours completing this class, which contains the following sequence of notebooks:

1. This class starts with our Architecture notebook, which will give you and understanding of the architecture of Splice Machine.
2. The Statistics notebook shows you how we use database statistics to optimize queries, and how you can use those same statistics for query tuning.
3. The Bulk Data Loading notebook introduces and walks you through using our Bulk HFile Import mechanism for highly performant loading of data.
4. The Transactions in Splice Machine notebook teaches you how transactions are processed in Splice Machine.
5. The Query Optimization notebook shows you advanced optimization techniques for boosting query performance.
6. The Prepared Statements notebook teaches you how to use prepared statements for querying your databases.
7. The User-Defined Functions and Procedures notebook walks you through creating, using, and modifying functions and procedures that you can use for complex database queries.
8. The Using spark-submit with the Native Spark DataSource notebook shows you how to take advantage of the Splice Machine Native Spark DataSource when running apps with spark-submit.
9. The Exercises for This Class notebook contains a number of exercises that you should complete to test your understanding of the content in this class.

Note that each notebook contains a link to the next notebook in the sequence, and many of the notebooks also contain links to related pages in our Splice Machine Documentation web.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Where to Go Next
Please start this class with the [*Architecture*](/#/notebook/2ED2G715J) notebook, which provides an overview of the architecture of Splice Machine.
